isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine Service, Model Year 1994 - 1998 - VALVE TRAIN: PUSH RODS , HYDRAULIC VALVE LIFTERS AND CAMSHAFT - Camshaft and Gear - Assembling Cam Gear to Camshaft

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possibly death, use welding gloves for this procedure.

caution.para: The replacement cam gear and timing disk assembly have been accurately timed at the factory. Because accurate timing upon reassembly cannot be assured, do not disassemble these components. Disassembly may consequently result in engine damage.

figure.caption: Assembling the Cam Gear Onto the Camshaft

step1.para: Heat the cam gear and timing disk assembly in an oven to 260°C (500°F).
While the assembly is heating, position the camshaft vertically near the oven. Clean the nose of the camshaft.
Install the thrust plate on its journal and place the cam gear key in its slot.

Wear welding gloves to remove the cam gear assembly from the oven. Quickly align the gear keyway with the key and position the gear assembly over the nose of the camshaft until the gear is seated against the retaining flange shoulder.
Allow the assembly to cool before installing the camshaft in the engine. Do not quench.
